_header: Of God and kind proceedeth all beauty
Subjects: envoys; clothing, against extremes of; women, against
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Leiden, Leiden University Library Vossius Germ. Gall. Q.9f. 102v [see Reimer (1998)
XReimer, Stephen R. “The Index of Middle English Verse: Some Corrections and Additions towards the Next Edition.” Notes and Queries 45 [243] (1998): 16-22, p. 19]
_description: John Lydgate, ‘A dyte of womenhis hornys’ — ten 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including four-stanza envoy

BodAsh59.First Lines:
Off god and kynde procedeþe al beauteeYitte crafft cane shewe
                    aforeine apparenceBut nature moste haue the souereinteeThinge
                    countrefaytee haþenoon existence …
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Noble Pryncesse of meeke benyvolenceBen saumple your hornes
                    caste a way
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here foloweþe nowe a moral balade withe Refrayde if hornes were awaye
                    bytwene nature and beavte etc by Lidegate (f. 33v)

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Off god and kynde procedith al bewtecrafft may shewe a foreyn
                    apparence…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…noble pryncessis of meek benyvolencebe example of hir your
                    nornes cast away

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Of god and kynde procedeth all beavteCrafte maye shewe a foreyne
                    apparende…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…Nobill princesse of meke benivolenceBy exampill of her your
                    hornes caste a waye

                    apparence…

CamTCC599.First Lines:
Of god and kynde procedeth all BeawteCraft may shewe a foreyne
                    apparenceBut Nature ay must haue the soueraynteThyng countyrfete hath
                    noon existence…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Nobyll pryncessys of meke benyuolenceBy example of hyr your
                    hornys to cast away

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[O]F god and kynd procedith al beauteCraft may showe aforeyn
                    apparence…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…kynde wrought hem with so grete diligenceTheyre beaute to
                    showe though hornes were awey

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Off god and kynde prodeithe al beauteCrist may showe aforeyn
                    apparence…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…kynde wrought them with so grete diligenceTheyr beaute to
                    shewe though hornes were away
